descriptions: Associated resources on the enviPath repository
ContaHMM GitHub repository for open research data from the project
New GitHub repository and README for the enviPath and broader scientific user community
Curated set of 3'000+ biotransformation-related gene sequences within the repository
The 192 profile Hidden Markov Models produced as part of this project
190+ chemically-annotated Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) for rapid functional annotation of contaminant biotransformation genes in metagenomes
Wackett, L. and Robinson S. “A prescription for engineering PFAS biodegradation.” Biochemical Journal (2024) 481 (23): 1757–1770.
Making waves: Enhancing pollutant biodegradation via rational engineering of microbial consortia. Water research 247 (2023): 120756.
enviPath–The environmental contaminant biotransformation pathway resource. Nucleic acids research 44, no. D1 (2016): D502-D508.
enviLink: A database linking contaminant biotransformation rules to enzyme classes in support of functional association mining. bioRxiv (2021): 2021-05.
Cultivation-independent genomes greatly expand taxonomic-profiling capabilities of mOTUs across various environments. Microbiome 10, no. 1 (2022): 212.

Robinson, S. Invited conference session convener, chair, and speaker, Society for Industrial Microbiology and Biotechnology NP Meeting, San Diego, CA, USA. “From metagenomes to mechanisms: predicting enzyme specificity from microbiomes”. San Diego, CA. January 2025.

Robinson, S. Invited workshop speaker for the “Genomics and Data Integration” workshop as part of the Microbial Secondary Metabolites in Microbiomes Symposium, “Mind the gap: challenges and opportunities in paired ‘omics”. Helsignør, Denmark. June 2024.
Robinson, S., Invited speaker. “Mining microbiomes for contaminant biotransformations” Swiss Society of Toxicology. Basel, CH. November 2024.

Poltorak, V., Robinson, S. “Inferring Contaminants Biotransformation Potential of Microbial Environmental Communities by Metagenomics.” 4th International Conference in Microbial Ecotoxicology, Gothenburg, Sweden. November 2024.
Started a new collaboration with Kunyang Zhang of Kathrin Fenner’s group and formally established a collaboration with Dr. Jasmin Hafner leading the enviPathPlus project.
The tool enviPath has 616 registered users and visits on the enviPath website are steadily increasing, with well over 25k visits since its initiation in 2016.

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  REPORT OUTPUT FOCUS:
  - 15 standard output categories in "List of Outputs" table
  - Each category: quantity number, descriptions list, URLs list
  - Separate descriptions from URLs even when mixed in same cell
  - Academic collaborations vs Industrial partnerships (distinct categories)
  - Preserve all detailed descriptions and web addresses
